* The Gambling Appeals Tribunal will handle appeals related to gaming licenses.

* The Tribunal's powers include affirming, quashing, or substituting the Commission's decisions.
* The Tribunal may also remit a matter to the Commission or reinstate a lapsed or revoked license.
* An appeal to the Tribunal must be filed within one month of the Commission's decision but can be extended by the Tribunal.
* A party to the Tribunal proceedings may appeal on a point of law to a higher court.

* Simplified point 4: More than one premises licence may have effect in relation to a track, provided that each licence relates to a specified area of the track and none of the licences cover the same area.
